api.title: UIPageControl
api.description: A control that displays a horizontal series of dots, each of which corresponds to a page in the app’s document or other data-model entity.

overview.description: For an example of a page control, see the Weather app when it's configured to display information for more than one location.

method.name: var currentPage: Int
method.description: The current page, shown by the receiver as a white dot.

method.name: var numberOfPages: Int
method.description: The number of pages the receiver shows (as dots).

method.name: var hidesForSinglePage: Bool
method.description: A Boolean value that controls whether the page control is hidden when there is only one page.

method.name: var pageIndicatorTintColor: UIColor?
method.description: The tint color to be used for the page indicator.

method.name: var currentPageIndicatorTintColor: UIColor?
method.description: The tint color to be used for the current page indicator.

method.name: var defersCurrentPageDisplay: Bool
method.description: A Boolean value that controls when the current page is displayed.

method.name: func updateCurrentPageDisplay()
method.description: Updates the page indicator to the current page.

method.name: func size(forNumberOfPages: Int) -> CGSize
method.description: Returns the size the receiver’s bounds should be to accommodate the given number of pages.

control.name: class UIControl
control.description: The base class for controls, which are visual elements that convey a specific action or intention in response to user interactions.

control.name: class UIButton
control.description: A control that executes your custom code in response to user interactions.

control.name: class UIDatePicker
control.description: A control used for the inputting of date and time values.

control.name: class UISegmentedControl
control.description: A horizontal control made of multiple segments, each segment functioning as a discrete button.

control.name: class UISlider
control.description: A control used to select a single value from a continuous range of values.

control.name: class UIStepper
control.description: A control used to increment or decrement a value.

control.name: class UISwitch
control.description: A control that offers a binary choice, such as On/Off.
